title: HCT I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carle Health (Urbana, IL) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: There is a 15-minute process. It ran very smoothly and the interviewer was very nice. They offered me a 30-minute interview the next day and an offer was extended to me.
Interview Questions: Have you ever encountered a difficult coworker and what did you do to rectify the situation?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: Consisted of three phone interviews, background and a drug test. Interview process was not too daunting. Overall well conducted. The trainers are the ones who are doing the interviews. The first interview is just a quick call by one of the managers asking for pay rate, availability, etc..
Interview Questions: How did you hear about us? have you ever worked with people? describe a time where you went above and beyond? They also asked a lot of hypothetical questions that consisted of hard situations to see how you would respond.

title: Medical Coder Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: Coding test was taken with review and manager interview followed by peer group interviews. Quick and easy interview process with main focus on coding experience as well as quality of work
Interview Questions: What is your previous experience?

title: Patient Contact Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: They will tell you all about the job but also how you can positively engage and impact the organization. Attention to detail and following processes in place will lead to success.
Interview Questions: How you assimilate to delivering great customer service as well as recognizing how you can change as needed and answering situational questions.

title: ED Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: First met with HR and interviewed with my availability and my expectations regarding the job. Then I interviewed with the department head where they asked about my experience and certification and they extended me an offer after
Interview Questions: What are my weaknesses and strengths?

title: Certified Nurse Midwife Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: It was very impersonal, cold, rigid, sterile, and was conducted in such a way that it seemed I was waisting their time. I wouldn't recommend working in the Midwifery practice.
Interview Questions: How many on call hours are you used to working?

title: BI Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by an AI chatbot requesting a 10 minute interview. My 10 minute interview lasted 3 minutes due to the company’s attempt to lowball me. Given their approach, they’re clearly targeting desperate candidates. Red flags all over this one.
Interview Questions: Are you desperate enough to accept half of what the industry is paying for this position?

title: Registered Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fast. They may ask where you see yourself in 5 years. And ask about your career up to this point. They may ask a few clinical questions. And they will have more than one person join in on the interview.
Interview Questions: Where I see myself in 5 years from now.

title: Clinical Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: Beginning with a phone screen and then a zoom interview a week later, the process was great. HR was so helpful, going the extra mile to answer my questions about benefits, and the hiring manager was very nice.
Interview Questions: What career path/5 year plan did I see for myself?

title: ED Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview process.  Questions were about previous work experience, schooling and certifications. Discussed available work hours and chose hours best fit for me. Few requirements needed before the start of employment.
Interview Questions: Asking about best and worst qualities.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very smooth and streamlined, some behavioral questions and makes sure you're able to carry out the duties you are assigned to on the job. Carle is a great place to volunteer at
Interview Questions: What is one of your greatest accomplishments?

title: Human Resources Specialist (HR Specialist) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: Fair but lengthy process. Multiple interviews with different people. Initial phone screen, HR interview, and two-part department interview. Took a while to hear back before I was ultimately given an offer.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the next 5 years

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health (Olney, IL) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process was quick and easy. I had one phone screening and one in person interview with the department manager. Communication was very clear. I did have to wait several weeks before starting orientation, though.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had a conflict with a coworker and how did you handle it?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview. The guy interviewing me called right on the dot and the questions asked were several behavioral questions. However, I later found out that the spot I applied for were already filled by internal applicants.
Interview Questions: If a patient was being rude, how would you react?

title: Print Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carle Health in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied one day, and called the next day. The interview was online in the same week, they sent me dates available for the interview and it was like 20 minutes with one woman of HR Company.
Interview Questions:
How can you contribute with company?
What is your experiences that will help this position?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: There were two rounds of interviews.  One was with the director.  Another was with the whole team.   Both interviews asked fairly standard questions, such as "Tell me about a time when..."
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time when  you didn't get along with a coworker.
Tell me about someone who has made an impact on you.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Carle Health (Normal, IL) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: quick easy to the point hired the next day very simple very in need of nurses. I was concered I would not get a job so quickly but extremely in demand for nurses.
Interview Questions: how would you give insulin

title: Actuarial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: I made it through a phone interview with HR, before going through a round of 3 interview with different members of the company, including the head actuary and the CFO of the company
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an actuary?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions:
Has 2 interviews
1 with HR
1 with manager and other staff 
Uses zoom and skype call for the interview
Questions are related to experience
Nerve racking 
Some technical difficulties during the interview so my interview was rescheduled
Interview Questions: Why do you want med surg?

title: Student Nurse Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: Submit an online application. If they like your application, they'll email you to set up a phone interview. If you pass the phone interview, they will set up an in-person interview with you.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a nurse?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: Question were related to the work and work ethics. Friendly interviewer.Interviewer was  really trying to find out if I am a good candidate for the position. It was overall good experience interviewing.
Interview Questions: How do you manage and plan priority at work.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: General patient care questions.  Very personable and felt welcomed throughout the screening. Did not take more than thirty minutes total. I hope to hear back soon! Looking forward to it.
Interview Questions: General patient care questions. Nothing too difficult.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: It is a long process.  Many interviews.  Took several weeks.  There is one phone interview and two zoom interviews.  Also the possibility for a job shadow.  Depends on how interviews etc go.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you made a mistake and how you handled it.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very simple interview. There was an HR screening where they basically just go over your resume, and then a sit-down interview with your potential manager. They asked for basic information, and standard interview questions like "what's your biggest strength" and general background information about yourself, and your past experience.
Interview Questions:
Q: Tell us about yourself
Q: Tell us about your past work experience
Q: What is your biggest strength? Weakness?

title: Patient Services Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions:
I was sent an email after my application was finalized for a phone interview. 
The person who contacted me was very concise and professional when I emailed them to ask for an earlier phone interview time that was not available on their online scheduler. They were prompt in their response and the interview was fairly quick. Went over the basics of my resume and they put my forth onto the next round of interviews.
Interview Questions: Looking at your skills, you have talked about what you excel at. What is something you need to improve on?

title: Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions:
A phone call from HR.
Scheduled interview with Hiring Manager and supervisor
Got a call back from HR after one week to discuss benefits, base salary.
the process was hitch-free.
After accepting the offer, a Physical examination was scheduled
Interview Questions:
What is your achievement this year
technical questions on cisco devices, wireless and monitoring tools

title: Summer Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carle Health in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online to position, received email request a couple months later for interview. I had a first interview with HR who asked general questions and a second interview with the head of student nurse internship. Did not get job offer.
Interview Questions: What are three characteristics your clinical preceptors would describe you as? What are three characteristics your peers would describe you as? What are three characteristics that you would say describe you?

title: Supervisor PSR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health (Gibson City, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Started process Dec 4 and finalized Jan 23.  First interview was with HR. A few hours later I recurved a call from the hiring manager. We set a date for the Friday after next. Second interview was with first manager. A week later set a date for the following Monday. Interviewed with director and three PSRs. A week later set up inter view with second manager and two other PSRs. Three days later HR calls with verdict. ☺️
Interview Questions: Do you have integrity.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Carle Health (Champaign, IL) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview for an internship position was quick and simple. Took about an hour to meet in person with the manager and team lead. I heard back in 4 days.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health (Urbana, IL) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: They were very professional. There was the manager as well as the residency manager there interviewing me. They seemed nice. Time ran out a bit so I was not able to go on a tour.
Interview Questions: Asked a question about delegation.

title: Hct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: Applied to job online through carle website. Two phone interviews and a 45 minute in person interview with manager. One on one interview.  Basic questions regarding previous experiences in healthcare field and work schedule availability.
Interview Questions: Describe a challenging situation you faced before and how did you handle it ?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Carle Health (Champaign, IL) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was a phone interview with an HR representative. This lasted for about 30 - 40 minutes. The second interview was with a hiring leader which lasted around 30 minutes, and then there was a 3rd interview with the position leader.
Interview Questions: What are the top 3 things you look for in a workplace?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health (Urbana, IL) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online. The process took about 3 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Clinic (Urbana, IL) in August 2018.

Application

I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Clinic (Urbana, IL) in August 2018.

Phone Interview, Interview with department manager, then job shadow and peer interview. Got a job offer and resigned from the current job I was working. Went through medical clearance, drug screen, etc...even received a welcome card from the department I was going to work in. However, even being truthful about my past from day one, and being told that it was ok...just 5 days before my first day at work (orientation) I was called by the HR Manager and was told that the job was being rescinded and I was not able to work there, all because the original person who did the phone interview did not write everything down correctly making it look like I was not being honest. I now have to wait at LEAST a year before I can apply again. Not sure I will even try, I'm trying elsewhere that will respect honesty.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Carle?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Very transparent and straightforward, friendly.
A little delayed to the appointment, but went overtime to compensate. 
Typical behavioral questions with some higher level overview of the position and work. 
Discussed compensation and relocation opportunities.
Interview Questions: From your past experience, describe someone who you believed to be a good leader.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: Casual interview to get to know me. They asked about my background and my interests. It's just to make sure you are a reliable candidate. It was a standard interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a strength and weakness

title: Desktop Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health (Urbana, IL) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was set up by a third part staffing agency, LRS Consulting Services.  I showed up for the interview and spoke with the three managers who run the IT Support department.  They did not ask a lot of technical questions. They did ask what I might do given a particular scenario I might encounter while on the job.  They were also very interested in the substance of the work which I had been doing at my previous job.
Interview Questions: Have you had meaningful experience working with Windows devices and software.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health (Urbana, IL) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was a 1 on 1 with the boss. Then a group interview with the other members of the team. Lasted about 10 min or less. Had the opportunity to job shadow.
Interview Questions: Name a time you "broke" the rules

title: College Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Carle Health (Champaign, IL) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Brief 15 minute interview. Very casual, asked basic interview questions just to make sure I wasn't a psychopath. Lady loved to talk, could have gone on for hours with her if i wanted to
Interview Questions: What are your 2 best accomplishments

title: Health Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Carle Health (Champaign, IL) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was nervous but was immediately put at ease by my recruiter and  she started just explaining a little about Carle and then looked over my resume that I brought with me (paper copies are great to have on hand) and asked me questions as she went through that. Next she asked me a bunch of standard questions listed below then gave me a list of open positions and asked me which ones interested me the most. She also handed me a book on the different benefits offered and went through some of it with me. Overall, it went really well and I felt very at ease by the end.
Interview Questions: Asked the basic questions: weaknesses, strengths, why am I a good fit for the job, how have I dealt with a difficult patient and how did I handle it, what are my goals, where do I see myself in 5 years, what am I looking for by working at Carle Hospital.

title: Medical Home Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carle Health (Champaign, IL) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was straightforward  but lengthy, taking a full month to complete four rounds of interviews. Did not have a great experience with HR - my recruiter was a bit scatterbrained and lacked prompt communication skills.
Interview Questions: "You do know you won't be working directly with patients, right?"

title: PSR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carle Health (Urbana, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Long!  I had to come back for three total interviews.  1 with human resources, another with the manager of my department and another where I was interviewed by a panel of coworkers.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work for Carle, why was I qualified - the usual.

title: Accounts Receivable Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carle Health (Urbana, IL) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview happened within the first two weeks. Then an initial interview with HR, followed by an interview with Karri and Amanda a week later.  Every person was approachable and very easy to talk to. There was a lot of laughing and joking going on during the interview which helped ease the nerves.
Interview Questions: What interests you about insurance?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: get called by HR if department wants to proceed with an interview, set up a time to do interview with the department. once interview is over the department will let HR know if they want to offer a position or not, if they do HR will contact you, so that you can contact the department.
Interview Questions: How do you want to leave your current position.

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Carle Health (Urbana, IL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Kind of a long process, took about two months before I got to orientation. Interviewed with HR then got a call two weeks later to interview with my manager and then about three weeks later was told I got the job.
Interview Questions: When was a time where you handled a situation in a professional manner?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Carle Health (Urbana, IL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Application was sent through an e-mail address. Administrative Assistant e-mailed me a few days after submitting my application to see if I was still interested and we scheduled a time/day with interviewer. Was interviewed by Director and it was fairly easy. She asked me my goals and interests and we talked for fairly long. I enjoyed it very much.
Interview Questions: What are your long-term goals?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health (Urbana, IL) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
1) First got contacted by the HR department. Essentially a small phone interview.
2) Contacted by one of the managers in the department to set up interview appointment.
3) Panel interview. 2-3 people. One of them most likely will be the manager assistant and the others will be the actual workers from that department.
4) Last and final interview - With the manager of the department
Interview Questions:
1) Asked about experience
2) What would you do if you had a difficult patient?
3) Where do you see yourself in 2-5 years?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carle Health (Champaign, IL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had an out of state interview, two interviews with recruiter aND THEN MANAGER , offered position and traveled to state to begin job and orientation process. Was given extra monies for re location as well
Interview Questions: how do you handle stress

title: Clinical Res Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health (Urbana, IL) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Application: The employers website is very easy to use and have your application filled out. My interview process has nothing to do with my application/resume.
Interview Process: Few days after the application has been submitted, HR called me for a preliminary interview. They asked me about education background and other qualifications. A week -10 days later, I received another call from HR confirming the interview time and date. On the day of, I was interviewed by the manager of the department. The interview lasted for 1 hour and was more casual than formal. It helped as I was already an employee and was transferring from one department to another.
The manager explained in great detail about the expectations and possible challenges. I was given time to ask questions regarding the position and they were answered to my satisfaction.

Compensation Negotiation: This was the worst experience ever. After being informed by the manager that I have been selected for the position, the HR was my next call to negotiate my compensation. Carle is one of the largest employers but does not tend to show the same intent when it comes to pay. I was offered the absolute lowest compensation, despite having the qualifications and experience. My education was not considered as HR thought - "everyone has bachelors and masters education", and my experience in healthcare was not "special". Despite several attempts, the compensation was not satisfactory and I only accepted it as it is a temporary situation.
Interview Questions: How long was I willing to stay with the Organization?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health (Champaign, IL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
1. Phone Screener (quick and easy- lasts about 20 minutes)
2. HR Screener (Simple questions- lasts about 40 minutes)
3. Interview with manager(More in depth and really gives insight on job. Lasted 1 hour) 
4. HR called and gave offee.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in healthcare?

title: Lab Specimen Processor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: Application online took about two weeks then called for an interview. I was interviewed one on one. It was pretty easy. They do a background check and drug test. They were mainly asking about previous work experience. The lady was nice and the pay is ok. The shift i was interviewed for was second shift. Previous medical lab work is required although not specified. No offer because i had lab experience just no medical.
Interview Questions: What is good customer service?

title: Patient Transport Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health (Urbana, IL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: First they do phone interview then call for physical interview and the third interview with department they also do drug test and background  check if you are working with patients you also go through a physical
Interview Questions: Why Patient Transport

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with respiratory Manager and a few co workers. I did a phone interview with HR first. Then scheduled manager with the manager and peer review. They discussed pay but it is very low even for a first year RRT
Interview Questions: Why would I like to work at Carle

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Carle Health (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Orientation and insurance classes...Long...wayyyyyy too long and the way they're set up is a waste of time and money. I came away from a week of Insurance class with next to nothing...horrible experience.
Interview Questions: Initial interview was pleasant, but their insurance classes and the way they have employee&#039;s jumping through hoops for crappy pay is absolutely horrible.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carle Health in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Took 3 interviews before I actually got offered the job. Interviews are very easy and the people are friendly. The last interview is with  a peer group. Second one is with the managers.
Interview Questions: Such as where do you see yourself in 5 years? Very common interview questions.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: It was mostly very general questions, and the woman was very kind. However, she was looking at someone else's records by accident and I got very confused when she asked me about my "history." She realized that this was a mistake. I met at the office and talked to the interviewer 1:1. Overall, I had a positive experience. I looked at this position through the website, and I contacted the person by phone to schedule an interview.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation where the person you were caring for pushed their religious views on you?

title: PSR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: It takes a little over a month to be hired on. You start by turning in your application, about a week or so later you get called for an interview with the recruiter. They send your info to the manager. If the manager is interested you get in interview with them about a week later. If they still like you, you come back for a peer interview within a few days to a week. Then within another week you will get a job offer and complete a physical and drug testing. If you accept right away you will start on the next "orientation" day (always a Monday).
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time that you had to make a decision without the help of your leadership

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: If you actually are called in after submitting your very detailed application online, expect a standard, planned interview. They are professional in the process and HR was friendly in person. Oh, and there is an online personality assessment, too. After the initial interview, you would probably interview with a department manager at least once. I've been through much more difficult interviews.
Interview Questions: The questions were pretty standardized. They look for people who have a strong service orientation--they ask questions that focus on customer service, interpersonal skills. "How would you define customer service?" "What would you do if you saw someone breaking a rule?" "What kind of job are you looking for?"

title: Emergency Department Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health (Urbana, IL) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter will schedule and arrange most of the interviewing process. They make an initial contact, schedule a phone interview, and forward your application to the department manager or director for further review. After an in-person interview, the recruiter will contact you again with an offer and salary negotiation based on their formula, which I feel undervalues experience you may have.
Interview Questions: Why should I pick you over other candidates?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was with HR nurse recruiter & from there I was taken to the office of the unit manager for an interview with her. Both were conducted in a very professional manner. Some of the questions asked were specific to how I would react to common situations that might arise as well as questions about my work history/experience. They now also conduct a peer interview as well in which unit employees have the opportunity to ask you questions & help determine if you might be a good fit for the unit.
Interview Questions: What would you describe as a quality that you feel you need improvement on.

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health (Urbana, IL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with a recruiter and they got me the interview. This process included a phone  interview that led to an on site interview with the manager. Since the interview went well, my recruiter got a hold of me 2 days later with an offer letter.
Interview Questions: They asked about what I know Windows easy transfer and how are react to certain situations and environments.

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Carle Health (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: They were very friendly and easy to get along with. Just asked standard questions about skills. I liked that they wanted to get to know me. It was a good atmosphere and were helpful.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Branch Manager Medical Supplies Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health (Urbana, IL) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was lucky enough to get a call from HR recruiter.  Set up interview with HR recruiter a week later.  Went in for interview with HR, that lasted an hour.  Then did a panel interview with 6 individuals at the location and that took an hour.  Was told they would call me in two weeks.  Waited two weeks and had to email the HR recruiter for an update.  was then told they decided to move forward with other candidates.
Interview Questions: Most difficult part was the panel interview after an hour ling interview with the HR recruiter.

title: Healthcare Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health (Urbana, IL) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The HR took a while to call but once they set up an interview everything ran very smoothly and they were helpful in answering in questions that I had.
Interview Questions: What is one of your strong points.

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Carle Health (Urbana, IL) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview was alright.  They will not interview you at the main campus, you have to go somewhere else and this can be a little confusing.  I arrived 15 mins early and had to wait for about a half an hour in a waiting area with other interviewees.  The interview itself was fine, nothing out of the ordinary.
Interview Questions: What attracts you to the Champaign/Urbana area?

title: Business Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was called within two weeks to do initial phone interview with HR and then in person. Next interview was with department manager and about an hour long. Basically hired on the spot considering references were okay. Scheduled for orientation and multiple health screens as the same time. Also given drug test before officially hired.
Interview Questions: Can you handle situations involving family members of deceased patients?

title: Enrichment Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Carle Health in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Carle Hospital first conducts a preliminary phone interview, then an in person interview with a human resource manager. If you are selected by HR, they will show your file to the hiring manager. He/she will then request a face-to-face meeting with you. If you are hired, you will report to their occupation medicine clinic for a physical and drug screening. Then you will have a two day orientation.
Interview Questions: Be prepared to answer difficult questions regarding patient confidently. Being a hospital, regardless the job, you will interact with patients.

title: Systems Support Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Carle Health (Urbana, IL) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions:
I applied through the online portal and received a call back three weeks later for an interview.  Interview was conducted in three parts, an hour meeting with an HR rep, 30 minutes with the hiring manager and 30 minutes with a group of help desk members.

HR rep did not show at the specified time and place, and that part was skipped until the end of the interview.  The dress code for the position is very casual, and even in the interview I felt overdress in just a button down, tie and slacks.

The questions were not difficult, mostly pertaining to technical knowledge of systems and willingness to take call after hours and if I had a license and automobile.  The help desk group asked the most challenging technical questions.
Interview Questions: Explain the steps you would use to troubleshoot and repair a PC that will boot up and run, but crashes whenever running a full screen application?
